Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I took a lot away from this course. I was able to study a variety of airpower theories and historical examples, and begin to develop a clear understanding of its advantages and disadvantages.
This class gave an excellent overview of Airpower theories, as well as assessments of efficacy.
You will develop very deep and specific knowledge about use of airpower since WWI.
Fantastic course on the progression of both the action and theories of airpower. Essential for those interested in the political and military effects of the use of airpower.

I liked that we read both airpower theory and historical airpower cases. Professor Lyall was very engaging, and incorporated a nice mix of teaching and leading discussions into each class, given that much of the material was new for most students. I was very pleased with this course, both in terms of its breadth and depth, and don't have any suggestions for improvement.

The greatest strength of the course is Prof. Lyall who is a great academic. Because this is a course mainly looking into history, much of the material read is not at the cutting edge of social scientific research. Many of the readings are also rather unscientific theories of important military leaders.
Plenty of productive discussion on the readings tied into current events. Weakness could be a relatively limited historical scope.
This was a great course that was able to do a complete overview of a fairly narrow subject.  The reading was for the most part very interesting and relevant to the course.
This course is incredible. I wish the commentary and engagement with more modern parts of airpower would have had more time

I would definitely recommend this course! It was an excellent introduction to, and analysis of, both airpower theory and historical airpower cases. Professor Lyall was very engaging, and incorporated a nice mix of teaching and leading discussions into each class, given that much of the material was new for most students. I was very pleased with this course, both in terms of its breadth and depth, and don't have any suggestions for improvement. The assignments were weekly reading and section participation, a ~10 page midterm paper, and a ~12 page final paper.
I absolutely would. There are not enough courses at Yale that look closely at military strategy, both US and foreign. This course takes steps in the right direction to fill that void.

Definitely take it. A necessary step for Yale to begin teaching military related courses. Professor Lyall did a phenomenal job with combining the theories with what was actually happening in the real world.
I would recommend this course to a student who has a deep interest in the subject matter.
Yes I would recommend this class. Great professor and great material. Not a ton of work and an in depth teaching of the entire history of air power and air power theory
Solid course, take the class to learn from Lyall
Yes, absolutely.  It is a fairly niche topic, however so I would only take it if you have a strong interest in airpower.  Professor lyall is fantastic and runs a great discussion.
If you want to have a really strong course on the military and political implications of airpower, this is it. Lyall is a brilliant professor as well and a great mentor.
If you enjoy learning about military effectiveness, specifically the through airpower, this is a great course for you! Professor Lyall is great and I enjoyed waking up early for this lass.
